p.strong: Hit Points. Hit Dice: 1d8 per Scout level. Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier. Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Scout level after 1st.

Proficiencies. Armor: Light Armour. Weapons: Simple Blasters, Simple or Martial Light Weapons with Finesse property, Sniper Rifle, Cycler Rifle, Simple or Martial Vibroweapons with Finesse property. Saving Throws: Dexterity and Intelligence.
Skills. Choose 4 from Acrobatics, Athletics, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand, Stealth.

description.p: Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage (the type of damage is determined by the weapon you use) to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. You must use a Finesse or ranged weapon. You don’t need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet, that enemy isn’t incapacitated, and you don’t have disadvantage on the attack roll. The amount of damage depends on your level in this class: lv 1: 1d6, lv 2: 1d6, lv 3: 2d6, lv 4: 2d6, lv 5: 3d6, lv 6: 3d6, lv 7: 4d6, lv 8: 4d6, lv 9: 5d6, lv 10: 5d6, lv 11: 6d6, lv 12: 6d6, lv 13: 7d6, lv 14: 7d6, lv 15: 8d6, lv 16: 8d6, lv 17: 9d6, lv 18: 9d6, lv 19: 10d6, lv 20: 10d6

sheet.description: Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage (the type of damage is determined by the weapon you use) to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. You must use a Finesse or ranged weapon. You don’t need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet, that enemy isn’t incapacitated, and you don’t have disadvantage on the attack roll. The amount of damage depends on your level in this class: lv 1: 1d6, lv 2: 1d6, lv 3: 2d6, lv 4: 2d6, lv 5: 3d6, lv 6: 3d6, lv 7: 4d6, lv 8: 4d6, lv 9: 5d6, lv 10: 5d6, lv 11: 6d6, lv 12: 6d6, lv 13: 7d6, lv 14: 7d6, lv 15: 8d6, lv 16: 8d6, lv 17: 9d6, lv 18: 9d6, lv 19: 10d6, lv 20: 10d6

description.p: Gain expertise in skills you're proficient with.

sheet.description: Gain expertise in skills you're proficient with.

description.p: Choose a feat to further customize your character.
Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide actions as a Bonus Action.

sheet.description: Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide actions as a Bonus Action.

description.p: When you roll for initiative, you can move up to your speed before initiative order is determined. This can be used once per long rest.

sheet.description: When you roll for initiative, you can move up to your speed before initiative order is determined. This can be used once per long rest.

description.p: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can halve the attack's damage against you.

sheet.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can halve the attack's damage against you.

description.p: When making a Dexterity saving throw: On a failed save, take half damage. On a successful save, take no damage (can’t use when incapacitated).

sheet.description: When making a Dexterity saving throw: On a failed save, take half damage. On a successful save, take no damage (can’t use when incapacitated).

description.p: When you make an ability check with a skill you’re proficient with, the lowest you can roll is 10.

sheet.description: When you make an ability check with a skill you’re proficient with, the lowest you can roll is 10.

description.p: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

description.p: No attack roll can have advantage on you unless you’re incapacitated

sheet.description: No attack roll can have advantage on you unless you’re incapacitated

description.p: You have an uncanny knack for succeeding when you need it. Your Dexterity and Intelligence scores increase by 2. Your maximum for those scores increases by 2. Additionally, if your attack misses a target within range, you can turn the miss into a hit. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check, you can treat the d20 roll as a 20. Once per long rest.

sheet.description: You have an uncanny knack for succeeding when you need it. Your Dexterity and Intelligence scores increase by 2. Your maximum for those scores increases by 2. Additionally, if your attack misses a target within range, you can turn the miss into a hit. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check, you can treat the d20 roll as a 20. Once per long rest.

description.p: Assassin - See Scout class description for details.
Operative - See Scout class description for details.
You gain a feature from your Scout subclass.
Choose a Scout subclass that defines your specialized path.
Thief form
You can use the Bonus Action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your Slicing Kit to disarm a trap, or open a lock.

sheet.description: You can use the Bonus Action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your Slicing Kit to disarm a trap, or open a lock.

description.p: You gain the ability to climb faster than normal; climbing no longer costs extra movement.

sheet.description: You gain the ability to climb faster than normal; climbing no longer costs extra movement.

description.p: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

description.p: Choose between gaining Forgery Kit proficiency or Hacker Kit proficiency.

sheet.description: Choose between gaining Forgery Kit proficiency or Hacker Kit proficiency.

description.p: You can take two turns during the first round of any combat encounter. You take your first turn at your normal initiative and your second turn at initiative minus 10. You can’t use this feature if you are surprised.

sheet.description: You can take two turns during the first round of any combat encounter. You take your first turn at your normal initiative and your second turn at initiative minus 10. You can’t use this feature if you are surprised.

description.p: Assassin form
Gain Poisoning Kit proficiency.

sheet.description: Gain Poisoning Kit proficiency.

description.p: You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn’t taken a turn in combat yet. Any hit against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

sheet.description: You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn’t taken a turn in combat yet. Any hit against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

description.p: Gain proficiency with Forgery Kit and Disguise Kit

sheet.description: Gain proficiency with Forgery Kit and Disguise Kit

description.p: You have advantage on initiative rolls. The first creature you hit during the first round of combat is easier for you and others to strike; attack rolls against that target have advantage until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: You have advantage on initiative rolls. The first creature you hit during the first round of combat is easier for you and others to strike; attack rolls against that target have advantage until the end of your next turn.

description.p: When you attack and hit a surprised creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, double the damage of your attack. On a successful save, your attack will do normal damage.

sheet.description: When you attack and hit a surprised creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, double the damage of your attack. On a successful save, your attack will do normal damage.

description.p: Operative form
You can move up to half your speed rounded up as a Reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

sheet.description: You can move up to half your speed rounded up as a Reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

description.p: When you are targeted by an attack while a creature within 5 feet of you is granting you cover, you can use your Reaction to have the attack target that creature instead of you.

sheet.description: When you are targeted by an attack while a creature within 5 feet of you is granting you cover, you can use your Reaction to have the attack target that creature instead of you.

description.p: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. If you have a climbing or swimming speed, this increase applies to that speed as well.

sheet.description: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. If you have a climbing or swimming speed, this increase applies to that speed as well.

description.p: You can use the Help action as a Bonus Action, and you can adopt a Fighting Style.

sheet.description: You can use the Help action as a Bonus Action, and you can adopt a Fighting Style.

description.p: If you take the attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as a Bonus Action. This attack can benefit from your Sneak Attack even if you have already used it this turn, but you can’t use Sneak Attack against the same target more than once per turn.

sheet.description: If you take the attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as a Bonus Action. This attack can benefit from your Sneak Attack even if you have already used it this turn, but you can’t use Sneak Attack against the same target more than once per turn.
